required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Caregiver Outlook: An Intervention to Improve Caregiving in Serious Illness
clinical_study.official_title: Caregiver Outlook: An Intervention to Improve Caregiving in Serious Illness

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock:
Informal caregivers provide a majority of care for patients during serious illness. Lack of preparation and completion may leave caregivers less capable of caring for a loved one or making crucial decisions influencing care.
This study will examine whether a preparation and completion intervention reduces caregiver anxiety, depression, anticipatory grief, and burden and improves patient quality of life and health care use.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators propose a randomized control trial to evaluate an intervention of preparation and completion with Veterans and their caregivers during serious illness. Specific aims are to 1) Evaluate the impact of the caregiver Outlook intervention on caregiver anxiety, depression, anticipatory grief, completion, and burden; 2) Evaluate the impact of the home versus in hospital, emergency department, or nursing facility; 3) Evaluate the impact of the intervention session's qualitative content, examining variation associated with selected demographic variables, quality of family communication, and stage of illness on change.
Caregivers in the first group ("Treatment", or "Preparation and life completion") will meet with a facilitator three times for a period of forty-five minutes each. In the first session, subjects will be asked to discuss issues related to relationship life review.
In session two, participants will be asked to speak in more depth about issues such as regret and forgiveness. In the final session, subjects will focus on legacy and celebration. Caregivers in the second group ("attention control" or "relaxation meditation") will meet with a facilitator three times for a period of forty-five minutes each and be asked to listen to a non-guided relaxation compact disk (CD) or participate in a guided relaxation exercise.
Participants in both groups will receive pre and post-test measures administered by a blinded interviewer. Outcome measures will be measures by the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - General (FACT-G), Quality of life scale, FACIT-sp sub-scale, Anticipatory Grief Scale, Caregiver Reaction Assessment, the Qual-E completion and preparation sub-scales, and patient days at home.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Profile of Moods States (POMS) anxiety sub-scale The anxiety sub-scale from the modified Brief Profile of Mood States (POMS),7110 a six-item measure of psychological distress. Individual items used a 5 point Likert scale (0-4). The sub-scale minimum score was 0 and maximum was 24 (more anxious ).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy - Spiritual Well-Being (FACIT-SP) subscale. The 12-item measure assess spiritual well-being: faith, meaning, and purpose. Individual items use a 5 point likert scale (0-4). The scale minimum score is 0 (negative well being) and maximum is 48 (positive well being).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Centers for Epidemiologic Study of Depression short form (CES-D) is a 10-item measure of depression. Items are rated on a 4 point Likert scale (0-3) with total scores ranging from 0 to 30. Higher scores indicate greater depressive symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Days of VA Hospital Use
secondary_outcome.description: The number of days that a patient used either the VA emergency department (ED) or was an inpatient at a VA hospital in the 6 months following randomization. Inclusion of non-VA utilization was made unpractical due to the long delay in filing for non VA reimbursement (up to 2 years). The original variable was Day AT home, defined to be 180 days minus the days in ED or inpatient hospital. This was changed to days of use due to distribution/modeling considerations.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Caregiver Reaction Assessment (CRA). The Caregiver Reaction Assessment is a 24-item multidimensional instrument designed to measure a caregiver's reactions to caregiving for family members with a variety of chronic illnesses. The esteem subscale has 7 items with a 5 level Likert scale: 1=Strongly Disagree to 5=Strongly Agree. The score is the average of the 7 items ranging from a low score of 1 associated with negative reactions and high score of 5 with positive reactions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life at the End of Life (Family Edition) is a 17-item measure of quality of life at the end of life assessing five domains: life completion, relationship with health care providers, preparation for death, physical symptoms and affective social support. The 3-item Life Completion subscale uses a 5 point (0-4) Likert scale. The subscale ranges from 0 (poor) to 4 (better outcome).

secondary_outcome.measure: Prolonged Grief - Number of Participants With Anticipatory Grief
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The Prolong Grief Disorder scale is a clinically-based diagnosis determination scale modified for this study. The components/requirements that were dropped were a) diagnosis should not be made until at least 6 months since death, and b) the disturbance is not better accounted for major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder or post traumatic stress disorder. The outcome was a dichotomized variable with 1 indicating symptoms of prolonged grief are present and 0 indicating insufficient symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life at the End of Life (Family Edition) is a 17-item measure of quality of life at the end of life assessing five domains: life completion, relationship with health care providers, preparation for death, physical symptoms and affective social support. The 5-item preparation subscale uses a 5 point (0-4) Likert scale. The subscale ranges from 0 (poor) to 4 (better outcome).

arm_group.description: three facilitator-led end-of-life preparation and completion sessions with a facilitator with both patient and caregiver
three facilitator led sessions of listening to a relaxation CD.

intervention.description: Caregiver subjects will discuss life review, issues of forgiveness and heritage and legacy.
Caregiver subjects will listen to a non-guided relaxation CD with facilitator.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with advanced cancer/Congestive heart failure/COPD/End stage renal disease who have a primary caregiver. Caregivers of Durham VAMC patients with advanced disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No caregiver present.
- Caregiver with Cognitive impairment/inability to speak on phone/non-English speaking

overall_official.affiliation: Durham VA Medical Center, Durham, NC

facility.name: Durham VA Medical Center, Durham, NC

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study conducted recruitment from June 2013 to October 2015. Potential patients were identified by data pulls and then medical record review as well as obtaining approval to approach from providers. Patients were approached both at select outpatient clinics at the Durham VAMC as well as being sent invitation letters with subsequent phone calls.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant pairs (seriously-ill veteran and primary informal caregiver) were consented and then each completed a baseline interview before the dyad was randomized. Enrolled participants may be excluded if either of the pair refused to consent or did not complete a baseline.

outcome.title: Caregiver Anxiety
outcome.description: Profile of Moods States (POMS) anxiety sub-scale The anxiety sub-scale from the modified Brief Profile of Mood States (POMS),7110 a six-item measure of psychological distress. Individual items used a 5 point Likert scale (0-4). The sub-scale minimum score was 0 and maximum was 24 (more anxious ).
outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
outcome.population: Comparing Caregiver anxiety levels between the Outlook and the Relaxation meditation arm. Differences in numbers analyzed versus group totals due to missing data.

measure.population: Comparing Caregiver anxiety levels between the Outlook and the Relaxation meditation arm. Differences in numbers analyzed versus group totals due to missing data.

measure.title: Patient Days of VA Hospital Use
measure.description: The number of days that a patient used either the VA emergency department (ED) or was an inpatient at a VA hospital in the 6 months following randomization. Inclusion of non-VA utilization was made unpractical due to the long delay in filing for non VA reimbursement (up to 2 years). The original variable was Day AT home, defined to be 180 days minus the days in ED or inpatient hospital. This was changed to days of use due to distribution/modeling considerations.
measure.units: Days in VA hospital or ER

analysis.param_type: expected change in difference in logs
analysis.estimate_desc: The expected change in the difference of the logs of expected Days in VA inpatient care or ED.

outcome.title: Caregiver Burden
outcome.description: Caregiver Reaction Assessment (CRA). The Caregiver Reaction Assessment is a 24-item multidimensional instrument designed to measure a caregiver's reactions to caregiving for family members with a variety of chronic illnesses. The esteem subscale has 7 items with a 5 level Likert scale: 1=Strongly Disagree to 5=Strongly Agree. The score is the average of the 7 items ranging from a low score of 1 associated with negative reactions and high score of 5 with positive reactions.
outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
outcome.population: Comparing Caregiver reaction assessment scores between the Outlook Intervention and the Relaxation Meditation arm.Differences in numbers analyzed versus group totals due to missing data.

The esteem subscale has 7 items with a 5 level Likert scale: 1=Strongly Disagree to 5=Strongly Agree. The score is the average of the 7 items ranging from a low score of 1 associated with negative reactions and high score of 5 with positive reactions.
measure.population: Comparing Caregiver reaction assessment scores between the Outlook Intervention and the Relaxation Meditation arm.Differences in numbers analyzed versus group totals due to missing data.

outcome.title: Caregiver Completion
outcome.description: Quality of life at the End of Life (Family Edition) is a 17-item measure of quality of life at the end of life assessing five domains: life completion, relationship with health care providers, preparation for death, physical symptoms and affective social support. The 3-item Life Completion subscale uses a 5 point (0-4) Likert scale. The subscale ranges from 0 (poor) to 4 (better outcome).
outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
outcome.population: Comparing life completion scores between the Outlook Intervention and the Relaxation meditation arm, caregivers only. Differences in numbers analyzed versus group totals due to missing data.

measure.description: Quality of life at the End of Life (Family Edition) is a 17-item measure of quality of life at the end of life assessing five domains: life completion, relationship with health care providers, preparation for death, physical symptoms and affective social support. The 3-item Life Completion subscale uses a 5 point (0-4) Likert scale. The subscale ranges from 0 (poor) to 4 (better outcome).
measure.population: Comparing life completion scores between the Outlook Intervention and the Relaxation meditation arm, caregivers only. Differences in numbers analyzed versus group totals due to missing data.

outcome.title: Prolonged Grief - Number of Participants With Anticipatory Grief
outcome.description: The Prolong Grief Disorder scale is a clinically-based diagnosis determination scale modified for this study. The components/requirements that were dropped were a) diagnosis should not be made until at least 6 months since death, and b) the disturbance is not better accounted for major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder or post traumatic stress disorder. The outcome was a dichotomized variable with 1 indicating symptoms of prolonged grief are present and 0 indicating insufficient symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
outcome.population: Number of participants indicating prolonged grief across the Outlook Intervention and the Relaxation meditation arm, caregivers only. Only six percent of the sample qualified as having prolonged grief, at baseline. Therefore there was not sufficient data for statistical modeling.

group.title: Caregiver Outlook - Caregiver
group.description: Three facilitator-led preparation and completion sessions with the caregiver discussing life review, issues of forgiveness and heritage and legacy (Intervention).

group.title: Relaxation Meditation - Caregiver
group.description: Three facilitator-led sessions of caregivers listening to a non-guided relaxation CD (Attention Control).

measure.title: Prolonged Grief - Number of Participants With Anticipatory Grief
measure.description: The Prolong Grief Disorder scale is a clinically-based diagnosis determination scale modified for this study. The components/requirements that were dropped were a) diagnosis should not be made until at least 6 months since death, and b) the disturbance is not better accounted for major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder or post traumatic stress disorder. The outcome was a dichotomized variable with 1 indicating symptoms of prolonged grief are present and 0 indicating insufficient symptoms.
measure.population: Number of participants indicating prolonged grief across the Outlook Intervention and the Relaxation meditation arm, caregivers only. Only six percent of the sample qualified as having prolonged grief, at baseline. Therefore there was not sufficient data for statistical modeling.

outcome.title: Caregiver Preparation
outcome.description: Quality of life at the End of Life (Family Edition) is a 17-item measure of quality of life at the end of life assessing five domains: life completion, relationship with health care providers, preparation for death, physical symptoms and affective social support. The 5-item preparation subscale uses a 5 point (0-4) Likert scale. The subscale ranges from 0 (poor) to 4 (better outcome).
outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks
outcome.population: Comparing preparation scores between the Outlook Intervention and the Relaxation meditation arm, caregivers only. Two scale items were inadvertently left out initially. Items were added back in when omission was noted. However, the large number of missing makes analysis inappropriate.

group.title: Caregiver Outlook - Caregiver
group.description: Three facilitator-led preparation and completion sessions with the caregiver discussing life review, issues of forgiveness and heritage and legacy (Intervention).

group.title: Relaxation Meditation - Caregiver
group.description: Three facilitator-led sessions of caregivers listening to a non-guided relaxation CD (Attention Control).

measure.title: Caregiver Preparation
measure.description: Quality of life at the End of Life (Family Edition) is a 17-item measure of quality of life at the end of life assessing five domains: life completion, relationship with health care providers, preparation for death, physical symptoms and affective social support. The 5-item preparation subscale uses a 5 point (0-4) Likert scale. The subscale ranges from 0 (poor) to 4 (better outcome).
measure.population: Comparing preparation scores between the Outlook Intervention and the Relaxation meditation arm, caregivers only. Two scale items were inadvertently left out initially. Items were added back in when omission was noted. However, the large number of missing makes analysis inappropriate.

reported_events.time_frame: During time of study participation, 8 weeks per participant. Adverse events were collected both systematically, by asking of events at each time point, and non-systematically.

group.title: Caregiver Outlook - Caregiver
group.description: Intervention: Three facilitator-led sessions with the caregiver discussing life review, issues of forgiveness and heritage and legacy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
